09:44 <vmassol> but not to implement logic or very little (just presentation logic)

11:00 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:23 <vmassol> is there a way (I think not) to have a subwiki that is viewable by guest but which doesn't take into account users created on the main wiki (ie it treats them as guests)?  
11:23 <vmassol> (trying to solve http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKIORG-35 )  
11:31 <+Denis> vmassol: not sure you should go that way to solve your issue or it will really work, but there maybe some hack possible though LDAP auth without try\_local or exclusion  
11:32 <vmassol> Denis: IMO the real solution is to have a separate instance but the only issue is that it's more costly in term of maintenance  
11:32 <vmassol> but that's still probably the best way  
11:32 <vmassol> wdyt?  
11:34 <+Denis> is it really an issue to edit the playground with an authenticated user ?  
11:34 <vmassol> that's not the issue  
11:35 <vmassol> or do you mean to forbid registration on playground?  
11:36 <vmassol> right now the issue is that we don't want spam on xwiki.org  
11:36 <vmassol> it dosn't work that well though as you can just see above ;)  
11:37 <vmassol> a lot of those people registering don't do anything useful with xwiki.org (some do though to comment for ex)  
11:37 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/lhj0516 looks like a spam user  
11:39 <vmassol> it's sure that making everyone register on xwiki.org is the simplest  
11:41 <+Denis> what you explains on the way registration should work could only be done with an ldap registration  
11:42 <vmassol> ok, but anyway I don't think this is the right solution  
11:42 <vmassol> the right solution is either:  
11:42 <+Denis> but this will not help, since this needs some "outside" registration and an ldap server, which does not ease maintenance  
11:42 <vmassol> - keep playground in the farm and make everyone register on main wiki  
11:42 <vmassol> - move playgrond out of the farm  
11:43 <+Denis> To avoid playground to be an open door on the rest, I see the second as better  
11:43 <vmassol> yes that was my reasoning too  
11:43 <vmassol> keep xwiki.org reg for people who want to contribute  
11:44 <vmassol> what we could do too is to remove playground.xwiki.org and instead have only playground.myxwiki.org,the reason we haven't done it is because we wantes a stable playground  
11:44 <+Denis> not sure this is needed  
11:45 <vmassol> if playground is out of the farm then playground.xwiki.org is a bit misleading for users who might think it's part of the same farm  
11:45 <vmassol> (this is what the guy is saying)  
11:45 <+Denis> I agree  
11:47 <+Denis> btw, yesterday I was looking at xwiki-platform-chat, and on ML, you tell your hopes to see it as an extension but there is a big issue, it needs to add some servlets… What are the plan about extension that would like to add servlets ?  
11:47 <vmassol> they shouldn't  
11:47 <vmassol> there's no reason to require a servlet  
11:48 <vmassol> (btw another answer is servlet 3.0)  
11:48 <vmassol> (but they shouldn't)  
11:48 <+Denis> sure, 3.0 would be a solution, but it is far too early  
11:48 <vmassol> (since they won't get init code which almost always lead to bugs)  
11:48 <vmassol> inetgration should be done with components, no servletrs  
11:50 <+Denis> I am a little bit afraid by the potential load increase due to initialization code while playing with no latency messaging  
11:50 <vmassol> and if they user servlet it means they'll bring their own config, etc, which isn't a nice integration (a nice integration would use xwiki properties)  
11:50 <vmassol> (xwiki-configuration I mean)  
11:50 <vmassol> yes of course there are some edge cases  
11:50 <vmassol> I was talking generally speaking  
11:50 <vmassol> like for REST integration  
11:50 <+Denis> sure, I fully agree with you  
11:50 <vmassol> (which is currently bad)  
11:51 <+Denis> I am here talking about these edge cases, like supporting BOSH and WebSockets communications  
11:51 <vmassol> well I'd say they're not extensions till we move to servlet 3.0  
11:51 <vmassol> well they are extensions  
11:51 <vmassol> but not installable extensions with EM  
11:52 <vmassol> type = other  
11:52 <vmassol> well they can still be installed with EM but will require some manual changes too  
11:52 <+Denis> would not this one in particular integrate the core ?  
11:53 <vmassol> BOSH/WebSockets?  
11:53 <+Denis> at least a good way to help do so  
11:53 <vmassol> sure, could be a good idea, would need to see what it means exactly  
11:54 <+Denis> in fact, it depends, but it is mainly introducing statefull connections  
11:55 <+Denis> (imo, BOSH is just a fallback to missing WebSockets)  
11:57 <+Denis> also, looking more wide, having an integrated XMPP server, is even better, since it also ensure all the session, presence, grouping and message synchronizations you need for live collaboration  
11:58 <+Denis> so more, that just WebSockets, should not we look at embedding vysper in the core ?  
12:03 <vmassol> I don't know this domain well, will need to do some research to reply ;)  
12:08 <+Denis> vmassol: apart of Fabio initiative, are you aware of anything else do about live collaboration ?  
12:08 <vmassol> nope  
12:26 <+Denis> vmassol: to get a quick idea of all you may do with XMPP, look at  http://xmpp.org/xmpp-protocols/xmpp-extensions/  
12:27 <+Denis> and this is only standardized discussions, there is nothing that prevent proprietary extension as well

17:29 <@sdumitriu> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/AttachmentTest.java#L60

17:36 <polx> has quit  
17:36 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <@sdumitriu> But the new attachment upload doesn't have more than one field, it's supposed to be multiple upload directly  
17:37 <@sdumitriu> There's no more "Add another file" button  
17:37 <@sdumitriu> The upload is instant, once you select a file it's uploaded  
17:38 <@sdumitriu> Normally, I'd just put both files in the field  
17:38 <@sdumitriu> But Selenium doesn't support that yet  
17:38 <@sdumitriu> Other are asking about uploading multiple files in Selenium  
17:38 <vmassol> hmm we need to decide if that's good or bad. So we don't support multiple uploads any more, we need to decide if we want tha to rnot  
17:39 <@sdumitriu> We do, just select more files in the dialog  
17:39 <vmassol> hmm is this supoprtedby all browsers?  
17:39 <@sdumitriu> Instead of having to click many times on "add another file", then "browse", just select them in one dialog  
17:39 <vmassol> I don't recall being able to do that in the past  
17:39 <polx> has quit  
17:40 <@sdumitriu> It's supported by all except IE, where we're using the old interface, with the "Add" button  
17:40 <@sdumitriu> The HTML5 upload is active only if the browser supports it  
17:41 <vmassol> ok so indeed we need to find a way to support this in selenium. What we could do is keep the test for IE (we have an annotation for that) and write a new test for other browsers and ATM give a link to a feature request in Selenium if it's not supported  
17:41 <vmassol> (at minimum we need to ensure we have a test for uploading with 1 file but that's probably the case)  
17:42 <@sdumitriu> http://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=2239
